title: Reich
summary: Reich (/ˈraɪk/;[1] German: [ˈʁaɪç] (listen), English: Riche) is a German word whose meaning is analogous to the meaning of the English word "realm". The terms Kaiserreich (literally the "realm of an emperor") and Königreich (literally the "realm of a king") are respectively used in German in reference to empires and kingdoms.  The Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary indicates that in English usage, the term "the Reich" refers to "Germany during the period of Nazi control from 1933 to 1945".[2]
